Text: Nu identifies the bodies in the trashed laboratory.
Glen, the Lion's Mane, of the Crimson Order.

His corpse stared into space with a look of agony. He
must have died in great pain.

And to think he was quite the renowned knight... Seal
off his magic, and this is what you get, I suppose.
Nu's interest soon shifts elsewhere.

There is another fallen knight in the lab.
He is still breathing.
Marco Granger. You were in the Crimson Order.
She had seen his face before.

He had beautiful blue hair and handsome features, and
he was very skilled as a dark knight to the point
that many spoke of him as a man who would one day
lead the Order.
Marco had also once been Nu's fiance.

They had exchanged many letters and danced together at
balls. But in the end, he had been nothing more than the
man her parents had promised her to.

She had no way of knowing how Marco felt, but she had
also never found it in herself to love him.

That didn't mean she despised him, though. She just
didn't harbor any romantic feelings for him,
but she did think he was a good person.

She wouldn't have minded being wed to him someday,
and having a husband admired by all would've likely
led to a dazzling future.

A path decided for her. A partner decided for her.
A future decided for her.

The Nu of the past had not had much will of her own.
She went through life acquiescing to the values of
her circumstances, obeying the words of those
around her.

She didn't think there was anything necessarily wrong
with that. But thinking back on it now, it would have
been a terribly narrow way to live.

As Nu looks down at Marco's face, the memory of a
certain ball suddenly comes back to her.

She smiles ruefully as she remembers the way she had
once led Marco and his comely face around like some
piece of jewelry.

It was a memory she would just as soon forget but
absolutely never would.
What're you up to, Nu?

Nu spins around as a voice suddenly addresses her from
behind.

She hadn't felt anyone approach, but that isn't much
of a surprise. She knows the voice's owner, after all.
Master Shadow...

An ordinary youth with black hair now stands in the
laboratory.
The boy walks past her and opens one of the cabinets.
This man was once my fiance.
Wow. So what're you gonna do?

Personally, I have no reason to let him live nor to
kill him.
Then that works for me.
The boy is looking for something as he speaks.

Master Shadow, I apologize for the delay, but I have
a report.
Okay.

The Shadow Garden is currently on standby in
concealed positions surrounding the Academy.
We are prepared act at a moment's notice if
you give the order.
Okay.

However, combat in a setting with limited magic comes
with risks.

The Seven Shadows are able to function as normal, but
at present only Lady Gamma is here in the capital.

And then...well, Lady Gamma isn't, how to say, the
best suited for this sort of operation...
She really isn't.

Um...yes. I-I myself am only at around half strength,
so...
I see.
Lady Gamma currently has command of all our forces.

She predicts that this inhibition on our magic won't
last for much longer, so she's told us to stand by and
avoid overextending ourselves.
Okay.

The Cult has yet to act and is instead capitalizing
on their advantage of having all magic sealed
away to bolster their defenses.

As for the Knight Order, the only ones who are likely
to be of any use in battle are Princess Iris and the
commanders of the reinforcement units.

Perhaps due to the wishes of the palace, there seems
to be an issue with the right of command.
Gotcha.

Unless you have any other orders, my lord, we will
remain on standby until the enemy makes a move.

Okay... Uh, wait a sec. Can you help me find
something?
You seen any mythril tweezers?
Oh yes, I believe they were over here.

Also some powdered earth dragon bone, and then an ash
enchanted stone...

Nu proceeds to procure items from the cupboards as
he lists them.
Thanks, you're a lifesaver.

Not at all... But may ask what you need all of this
for?
We gotta adjust an artifact.
An artifact...! You know how to do even that?!

She had never imagined that the boy would be so well-
versed even in artifacts, but it isn't all that strange
when she considers who he is.

Still, why would he need to calibrate an artifact in
circumstances like these?

What's cutting off all the magic is this artifact
called the Eye of Avarice.

And we're in the final stages of adjusting this other
artifact that'll temporarily nullify the Eye's effects.

How could he have already discerned the source
of the magic blockage and even prepared a way
of counteracting it?

Furthermore, concocting a means of nullifying an
artifact capable of causing a blockage of this scale
would require an exceptional amount of knowledge.

It would be impossible without a level know-how found
only in the highest authorities in the kingdom. Nu
found herself trembling in the face of her lord's
immeasurable intellect.
I think we should be finished by around sunset.

Then, we shall make preparations to mobilize
coinciding with this.
I'm lookin' forward to it.
Yes.

After she watchs him leave with his armload of
utensils, she turns her attention to her once-
fiance.
You didn't hear any of that just now, I trust?
She places her ebony katana against his neck.

His breathing and pulse are normal and steady. Marco
is alive but unmistakably unconscious.
Consider yourself fortunate.

I can't allow anyone to know Master Shadow's true
identity, no matter who they are.
Nu leaves a small cut Marco's neck, then vanishes.
